channel.title: Posts on Kavinder's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Kavinder's Blog

item.title: 6/30/20 Learning Log
item.description: Some Git Knowledge: Instead of using GIT_SSH_COMMAND to override the default ssh configuration, you can also set a specific ssh command at the repo level with `git config core.sshCommand “ssh -i ~/.ssh/my_other_key” Some C++ Knowledge: I thought typedef was the only way to create a type alias. The same can be done with using Alias = Original.

item.title: 6/29/20 Learning Log
6/26/20 Learning Log
item.description: This is a record of anything I learn on the day. This is an effort to make learning more purposeful. Posting this in a blog ought to be somewhat of a motivator. Git: I was getting tired of having to remember/lookup my current branch when pushing to origin. git branch --show-current will provide that. So instead git push origin \(git branch –show-current)`ssg Git: GIT_SSH_COMMAND='<COMMAND>' to specify a specific ssh command when pushing a git repo.
